Wikipedia:All percentages with their corresponding grades shown here are just approximate guidelines because ultimately at the end of all major examinations (Primary School Leaving Examinations or PSLE in short  GCE N  O and A Levels) the Ministry of Education  Singapore  will *Moderate* the results. Hence  an A grade for instance may no longer be at 70%. It could possibly be 68% or even 73% depending on the performance of the cohort. This is usually done to preventgrade inflation.
